            </gmd:citation>
            <gmd:abstract>
                <gco:CharacterString>The University of Calgary Environmental Science Program has an annual field school in the lower Kananaskis Valley, SW Alberta, that occurs in the first week of September.  At several river sites, largely consistent among years, senior students collect data on water chemistry, macroinvertebrates and hydrology.  Water chemistry data are obtained using field and lab instruments by the students and by a lab technician. These annual data are analyzed each year by students to assess human impacts associated with recreation in the valley.</gco:CharacterString>
            </gmd:abstract>

keywords_translation_method.fr: Keyword text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

name: 10-25976-b9zx-bd54
notes: The University of Calgary Environmental Science Program has an annual field school in the lower Kananaskis Valley, SW Alberta, that occurs in the first week of September.  At several river sites, largely consistent among years, senior students collect data on water chemistry, macroinvertebrates and hydrology.  Water chemistry data are obtained using field and lab instruments by the students and by a lab technician. These annual data are analyzed each year by students to assess human impacts associated with recreation in the valley.

notes_translated.en: The University of Calgary Environmental Science Program has an annual field school in the lower Kananaskis Valley, SW Alberta, that occurs in the first week of September.  At several river sites, largely consistent among years, senior students collect data on water chemistry, macroinvertebrates and hydrology.  Water chemistry data are obtained using field and lab instruments by the students and by a lab technician. These annual data are analyzed each year by students to assess human impacts associated with recreation in the valley.
notes_translated.fr: Le programme des sciences de l'environnement de l'Université de Calgary organise une école de terrain annuelle dans la basse vallée de Kananaskis, dans le sud-ouest de l'Alberta, qui a lieu la première semaine de septembre. Sur plusieurs sites fluviaux, les étudiants de terminale collectent des données sur la chimie de l'eau, les macroinvertébrés et l'hydrologie, ce qui est assez constant d'une année à l'autre. Les données sur la chimie de l'eau sont obtenues à l'aide d'instruments de terrain et de laboratoire par les étudiants et par un technicien de laboratoire. Ces données annuelles sont analysées chaque année par les étudiants afin d'évaluer les impacts humains associés aux loisirs dans la vallée.

notes_translation_method.fr: Description text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

description_translated.en: DataStream is an open access platform for sharing water and sediment quality data.
description_translated.fr: DataStream est une plateforme en libre accès pour partager des données sur la qualité de l'eau et des sédiments.
